A controlled study in North AmericaÂ found that placing gas-impermeable barriers across the bottom of the lake (several small fabric covers or one large cover) significantly reduced the abundance of Asian clams.
background_information:
Background information and definitions:
Gas-impermeable barriers can be placed on the river or lake bed as a possible management tool for Asian clams Corbicula spp.. As organisms beneath die, oxygen levels fall and this can result in clam death.
